overview: Srinagar, the summer capital of Jammu and Kashmir, lies in the Kashmir Valley. It has become safer to travel since 2021 but retains a strong police/army presence. The city is known for its lakes, Mughal gardens, and historic sites, and offers a mix of cultural and natural attractions.
bestTimeToVisit: Summer months (May to September) when temperatures are cool to pleasant; light sweaters may be needed for occasional cool evenings.
idealDuration: 2–3 days to cover the main lakes, gardens and historic sites.
travelTips: Register with authorities upon arrival at the airport or your accommodation.
Carry a printed copy of your flight ticket; security checks can delay entry to the airport.
Winter requires full gear; snow and limited hot water are common.
Negotiate rickshaw fares in advance; typical short rides cost around ₹70.
Shared Sumo taxis from Jammu cost about ₹300–₹400 per person; private hire is ₹1,900–₹2,700.
Mini‑bus from the airport to the Tourist Reception Centre costs ₹70 but can be dirty.
Auto‑rickshaws and private buses are widely available for city travel.
Be prepared for heavy police and military presence; respect security protocols.
Avoid traveling alone at night in remote areas and keep valuables secure.
